docs.title: Type declaration
docs.text:
• (...args): T

Describes a function that is a constructor for T.

docs.title: Type declaration
docs.text:
▸ (...args): T

Describes a function returning an instance of T.

docs.title: Maybe
docs.text:
Ƭ Maybe\<T>: T | Nil

A type that could be either what you want, or Nil.

docs.title: Mixin
docs.text:
Ƭ Mixin\<T>: InstanceType\<ReturnType\<T>>

Describes a class "mixin", which is a function that returns a dynamically constructed class, based on the passed parameters.

docs.title: Nil
docs.text:
Ƭ Nil: null | undefined

When you want to normalize away null | undefined, or deal with either type through a consistent interface.

docs.title: Type declaration
docs.text:
▸ (delta, timestamp): unknown

The signature of a function that is called to draw a frame.

docs.title: SerializedError
docs.text:
Ƭ SerializedError: Record\<string, Record\<string, string> | string | undefined>

The shape of an Error instance, after it has been serialized into a simple hash.

docs.title: Isqrt
docs.text:
▸ Isqrt(value): number

Finds the integer square root of a positive number.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description value number The value to calcuate the square root for.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The square root for the given value.

docs.title: blend
docs.text:
▸ blend(src, dst, alpha): number

Returns a new color that is a blend between a source and a destination color linerally. The alpha component in these colors is ignored. Instead, the provided alpha value is used to blend between the two colors.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description src number The source color. dst number The destination color. alpha number The alpha value to use for blending.

docs.title: blendAdditive
docs.text:
▸ blendAdditive(src, dst, alpha): number

Returns a new color that is a blend between a source and a destination color additively. The alpha component in these colors is ignored. Instead, the provided alpha value is used to blend between the two colors.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description src number The source color. dst number The destination color. alpha number The alpha value to use for blending.

docs.title: blendSubtractive
docs.text:
▸ blendSubtractive(src, dst, alpha): number

Returns a new color that is a blend between a source and a destination color subtractively. The alpha component in these colors is ignored. Instead, the provided alpha value is used to blend between the two colors.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description src number The source color. dst number The destination color. alpha number The alpha value to use for blending.

docs.title: cosDeg
docs.text:
▸ cosDeg(value): number

Calculates the cosine for a given degree value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description value number The value in degrees to calculate the cosine for.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description degrees number The degrees to convert to radians.

docs.title: difference
docs.text:
▸ difference\<T>(a, b): T[]

Returns an array that holds all items that only appear in a.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description a T[] The first array. b T[] The second array.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
T[]

A new array which holds the items that ony appear in a.

docs.title: distance
docs.text:
▸ distance(x1, y1, x2, y2): number

Calculates the distance between two vectors.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description x1 number The X component of the first vector. y1 number The Y comoinent of the first vector. x2 number The X component of the second vector. y2 number The Y component of the second vector.

docs.title: errorToJSON
docs.text:
▸ errorToJSON(error): string

Serializes an error into a JSON string.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description error Error The error to stringify.

docs.title: errorToRecord
docs.text:
▸ errorToRecord(error): Record\<string, unknown>

Converts an error into a regular hash.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description error Error The error to convert.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
Record\<string, unknown>

A new object that contains all the properties of the error.

docs.title: errorToSimpleSerializable
docs.text:
▸ errorToSimpleSerializable\<TError>(error): SerializedError

Serializes an error into a simpler shape.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description error TError The error to serialize.

docs.title: filterType
docs.text:
▸ filterType\<T>(array, InstanceType): T[]

From an array with unknown contents, retrieve all the elements that are of a certain type and return them as a new array.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description array unknown[] The array to filter. InstanceType ConstructorOf\<T> The type to search for.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
T[]

A new array with the filtered items.

docs.title: formatString
docs.text:
▸ formatString(string, ...formatArguments): string

Formats a given input string with numeric placeholders.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description string string The input string with placeholders. ...formatArguments string[] An array of strings to place into the placeholders.

docs.title: formatStringTemplate
docs.text:
▸ formatStringTemplate(string, parameters): string

Formats a given input string with alphanumeric placeholders.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description string string The input string with placeholders. parameters Record\<string, undefined | string> A hash of parameters to place in the placeholders.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
string

The formatted string.

Example

// returns "Hello World"
formatString("{first} {second}", { first: "Hello", second: "World" });

docs.title: fromRGB
docs.text:
▸ fromRGB(r, g, b): number

Constructs a 32bit integer value that represents an RGBA color value. The A component is fixed to 255

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description r number The R component. g number The G component. b number The B component.

docs.title: fromRGBA
docs.text:
▸ fromRGBA(r, g, b, a): number

Constructs a 32bit integer value that represents an RGBA color value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description r number The R component. g number The G component. b number The B component. a number The A component.

docs.title: getA
docs.text:
▸ getA(color): number

Extracts the A component from a color value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description color number The color value.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The A component of the color value.

docs.title: getB
docs.text:
▸ getB(color): number

Extracts the B component from a color value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description color number The color value.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The B component of the color value.

docs.title: getG
docs.text:
▸ getG(color): number

Extracts the G component from a color value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description color number The color value.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The G component of the color value.

docs.title: getR
docs.text:
▸ getR(color): number

Extracts the R component from a color value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description color number The color value.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The R component of the color value.

docs.title: intersect
docs.text:
▸ intersect\<T>(a, b): T[]

Returns an array that holds all items that appear in both passed arrays.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description a T[] The first array. b T[] The second array.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
T[]

A new array which holds the items that appear in both passed arrays.

docs.title: is
docs.text:
▸ is\<T>(nilable, InstanceType): nilable is T

Check if something is a concrete value of the given type. Can be used as a typeguard.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description nilable Maybe\<T> The subject that could be nil. InstanceType ConstructorOf\<T> The type to check against.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
nilable is T

true if the input element matches the given type, false otherwise.

docs.title: isError
docs.text:
▸ isError(subject): subject is Error

Determine if the given unknown subject is an Error instance.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description subject unknown The object to inspect.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
subject is Error

true if the subject is an Error, false otherwise.

docs.title: isInteger
docs.text:
▸ isInteger(value): boolean

Checks whether a number is an integer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description value number The value to check.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
boolean

true when the value is an integer, false otherwise.

docs.title: isNil
docs.text:
▸ isNil\<T>(subject): subject is Nil

Check if something is nil. Can be used as a typeguard.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description subject Maybe\<T> The subject that could be nil.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
subject is Nil

true if the subject is nil, false otherwise.

docs.title: mustExist
docs.text:
▸ mustExist\<T>(subject, errorMessage?): T

Ensure that the passed subject is not nil; throw otherwise.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description subject Maybe\<T> A subject that is possible nil. errorMessage? string An optional error message to throw when the subject is nil.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
T

The subject, if it isn't nil.

Throws

When the subject is nil.

docs.title: nextPalette
docs.text:
▸ nextPalette(): void

Switches the global palette to the next available preset.

docs.title: putPixel32
docs.text:
▸ putPixel32(canvas, x, y, color, alpha): void

Linearly blends a new pixel with an existing color value in a Canvas.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description canvas Canvas The Canvas to interact with. x number The X coordinate at which to place the pixel. y number The Y coordinate at which to place the pixel. color number The color of the pixel. alpha number The alpha value to use to blend the pixel with existing color at the location.

docs.title: putPixel32Add
docs.text:
▸ putPixel32Add(canvas, x, y, color, alpha): void

Additively blends a new pixel with an existing color value in a Canvas.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description canvas Canvas The Canvas to interact with. x number The X coordinate at which to place the pixel. y number The Y coordinate at which to place the pixel. color number The color of the pixel. alpha number The alpha value to use to blend the pixel with existing color at the location.

docs.title: putPixel32Sub
docs.text:
▸ putPixel32Sub(canvas, x, y, color, alpha): void

Subtractively blends a new pixel with an existing color value in a Canvas.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description canvas Canvas The Canvas to interact with. x number The X coordinate at which to place the pixel. y number The Y coordinate at which to place the pixel. color number The color of the pixel. alpha number The alpha value to use to blend the pixel with existing color at the location.

docs.title: putSubPixel32
docs.text:
▸ putSubPixel32(canvas, x, y, color, alpha): void

Linearly blends a new pixel with an existing color value in a Canvas. Compared to putPixel32, this function supports sub-pixel placement, but is dramatically slower.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description canvas Canvas The Canvas to interact with. x number The X coordinate at which to place the pixel. y number The Y coordinate at which to place the pixel. color number The color of the pixel. alpha number The alpha value to use to blend the pixel with existing color at the location.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description radians number The radians to convert to degrees.

docs.title: randomRange
docs.text:
▸ randomRange(min, max): number

Returns a random value in a given range. Uses the JS-internal Math.random(). Use {MathHelper} for a PRNG with more features.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description min number The lower bound. max number The upper bound.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

A random value between the lower and upper bound.

docs.title: safeRGBComponent
docs.text:
▸ safeRGBComponent(c): number

Constrains a color component value to single-byte range (0-255).

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description c number A color component value.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The input value constrained into single-byte range.

docs.title: seedFromString
docs.text:
▸ seedFromString(input): number

Generates a numberic seed, to be used as an input for a PRNG, from a string.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description input string The string to use as a seed.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

A numeric seed value for a PRNG.

docs.title: shuffleArray
docs.text:
▸ shuffleArray\<T>(array): T[]

Places the items in the array in random order.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description array T[] The array to shuffle.

docs.title: sinDeg
docs.text:
▸ sinDeg(value): number

Calculates the sine for a given degree value.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description value number The value in degrees to calculate the sine for.

docs.title: sleep
docs.text:
▸ sleep(duration): Promise\<void>

Wait a given period before continuing execution.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description duration number How many milliseconds to wait.

docs.title: somecolor
docs.text:
▸ somecolor(): number

Retrieves a random color from the current global palette.

docs.title: toGrayScale
docs.text:
▸ toGrayScale(color): number

Converts a color value to grayscale.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description color number The color to convert.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The grayscale value appropriate for the color.

docs.title: unknownToError
docs.text:
▸ unknownToError(subject): AbstractError

Returns an AbstractError that best represents the passed subject. If the passed subject is already an AbstractError, it is returned as-is. Otherwise, it will be converted into an appropriate error type.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description subject unknown The subject to inspect

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description code string The main identification code for the error. message string The main error message. status number The HTTP status code to return.

docs.title: info
docs.text:
• info: Maybe\<string>

A user-friendly error message that may be transported to the client.

Deprecated

User-friendly errors should be read from extensions.

docs.title: inner
docs.text:
• inner: Maybe\<Error>

Another error that should be transported with this error.

Deprecated

We don't make use of this or interpret nested errors at all.

docs.title: status
docs.text:
• status: number

The HTTP status code to associate with this error.

Deprecated

We no longer respond to HTTP requests with error-specifc status codes.

docs.title: isAbstractError
docs.text:
▸ isAbstractError(error, allowForeignModule?): error is AbstractError

Checks if an object is an instance of AbstractError, or one of its subclasses.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Default value Description error unknown undefined The object to check. allowForeignModule boolean true Only check for similar looking error codes. You're going to want to use this if you're dealing with a setup where multiple versions of js-utils are loaded.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
error is AbstractError

true if the object is an AbstractError, false otherwise.

docs.title: Class: Canvas
docs.text: A wrapper around HTMLCanvasElement to provide some convience for double-buffered drawing.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description canvas HTMLCanvasElement The canvas to wrap. width number The width of the canvas. height number The height of the canvas.

docs.title: context
docs.text:
• Readonly context: CanvasRenderingContext2D

The CanvasRenderingContext2D we're using to draw to the canvas.

docs.title: pixMap
docs.text:
• Readonly pixMap: ImageData

The ImageData object that represents our frontbuffer, which is the canvas itself.

docs.title: clearWith
docs.text:
▸ clearWith(color): void

Fills the entire backbuffer with the given color.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description color number The color to fill the backbuffer with.

docs.title: getPixel32
docs.text:
▸ getPixel32(x, y): number

Returns the color of a pixel in the backbuffer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description x number The X coordinate to retrieve. y number The X coordinate to retrieve.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The color of the pixel at the given local.

docs.title: setPixel32
docs.text:
▸ setPixel32(x, y, color): void

Colors a pixel in the backbuffer.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description x number The X coordinate to color. y number The Y coordinate to color. color number The color to place at the coordinate.

docs.title: update
docs.text:
▸ update(): void

Draws the backbuffer onto the canvas.

docs.title: constructor
docs.text:
• new Random(seed?): Random

Creates a pseudo-random value generator. The seed must be an integer.

Uses an optimized version of the Park-Miller PRNG. http://www.firstpr.com.au/dsp/rand31/

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Default value Description seed number 0 The seed for the random number generator.

docs.title: next
docs.text:
▸ next(): number

Returns a pseudo-random value between 1 and 2^32 - 2.

docs.title: nextFloat
docs.text:
▸ nextFloat(): number

Returns a pseudo-random floating point number in range [0, 1).

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

a pseudo-random floating point number in range [0, 1).

docs.title: simplex2
docs.text:
▸ simplex2(x, y): number

Returns a 2D simplex noise value for a given input coordinate.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description x number The X input coordinate. y number The Y input coordinate.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
number

The noise value for the input coordinates.

License

ISC

Author

Joseph Gentle

See

https://github.com/josephg/noisejs

docs.title: Class: RenderLoop
docs.text: Conveniently provides a way to have a render loop called at a constant frame rate.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description renderLoop RenderLoopCallback The function to call when a new frame should be drawn. canvas? Canvas When provided, the canvas is automatically updated after a frame was rendered.

docs.title: renderLoop
docs.text:
• Readonly renderLoop: RenderLoopCallback

A function that we call when a new frame should be drawn.

docs.title: Class: UnknownError
docs.text: Used when an unknown, non-Error-like object was caught and converted into a real Error instance. Like when you catch a throw "boom", we will convert the caught "boom" into an UnknownError. To enrich an Error-like object that was caught, use the InternalError.

docs.text: Name Type Default value Description error unknown undefined The object to check. allowForeignModule boolean true Only check for similar looking error codes. You're going to want to use this if you're dealing with a setup where multiple versions of js-utils are loaded.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
error is AbstractError

true if the object is an AbstractError, false otherwise.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description x number The X component. y number The Y component.

docs.title: x
docs.text:
• x: number

The X component of the vector.

docs.title: y
docs.text:
• y: number

The Y component of the vector.

docs.text:

Adds another vector to this vector.

docs.text: Name Type Description vector Vector2 The vector to add to this vector.

docs.title: addMultiply
docs.text:

Scales another vector and adds it to this vector.

docs.text: Name Type Description vector Vector2 The vector to add to this vector. scale number The scaling to apply to the input vector.

docs.text:

Adds another vector to this vector.

docs.title: clamp
docs.text:
▸ clamp(floor, ceil): Vector2

Clamps the components of the vector at the given boundary.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description floor number The lowest value to allow. ceil number The largest value to allow.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Description vector Readonly\<Vector2> The vector to compare this vector to.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
boolean

true if the vectors are idently, false otherwise.
